name: Greek Artichoke Appetizer
author: Bret Gentry
summary: I got this recipe from my mother.  This is one of the many great recipes my family and friends love.
ingredients: 2 (6 ounce) jars marinated artichoke hearts, divided
½ teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
¾ pound sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Drain marinade from one jar of artichoke hearts into a skillet
Pour artichoke hearts from drained jar and the entire second jar (marinade and artichoke hearts) into a food processor
Blend until artichoke hearts are coarsely chopped and set aside
Cook and stir onion and garlic in the skillet with marinade over medium-low heat until onions are light brown, 5 to 7 minutes
Remove from heat and transfer to a large bowl
Stir onion mixture, eggs, bread crumbs, salt, black pepper, oregano, and hot pepper sauce together until well mixed
Stir sharp Cheddar cheese, parsley, Parmesan cheese, and chopped artichoke heart mixture into the onion mixture
Pour mixture into prepared baking dish
Bake in preheated oven until top is golden, 25 to 30 minutes
Cut into 1-inch squares and serve warm or cold
